name: St. Ivo of Chartres
summary: Ivo of Chartres was Bishop of Chartres from 1090 to 1115. He was one of the most important canonists of the Middle Ages and a key figure in the Gregorian Reforms. He compiled important collections of canon law and was known for his learning and wisdom. He worked to reform the clergy and combat simony. He was a supporter of the papacy but also sought to mediate conflicts between popes and secular rulers. He was canonized in the 17th century.
